title: Richmond training tourism ambassadors for UCI Road World Cycling Championship
text:
Richmond training tourism ambassadors for UCI Road World Cycling Championship Published on : Wednesday, July 22, 2015
Richmond Region Tourism is training tourism ambassadors for the UCI Road World Cycling Championship which will hit the streets of Richmond in less than 60 days. Richmond, the capital of Virginia, is among America’s oldest cities.
The tourism ambassadors are being trained to help the thousands of visitors that will be in Richmond. This training is separate from volunteer sign-up for the race.
All the “I Am Tourism” ambassadors are attending classes which will enable them to work at the kiosks or the information desks.
Due to the growing interest and demand with the upcoming race, the classes which are normally only open to certain people (hotels and convention centers) have also been opened to the public (monthly classes).
As part of the training, Participants are touring top attractions in Richmond and learning how to market them to visitors.
